purpose: Test Flux Dev FP8 quality with high-detail fur rendering, aiming for 0.70+ CLIP scores

experiments.feedback: Good baseline, fur could be more detailed
Studio lighting, highest score at low steps
Action shot with tennis ball, lower score likely due to complexity
Higher steps + resolution, improved fur detail, landscape orientation
BEST - Broke 0.70! Reddish-gold Issa-style coloring, portrait orientation, detailed fur with individual strands, backlight rim lighting effect

key_learnings: Flux Dev FP8 working on RTX 5090 with 32GB VRAM
100 steps significantly improves detail over 25 steps
Portrait orientation (1024x1536) focuses on subject better than landscape
Specific fur texture prompts help: 'individual silky strands', 'wispy ear feathers', 'subsurface scattering'
Reddish-gold/auburn coloring produces more realistic results than generic 'golden'
Negative prompt for fur: 'smooth fur, flat lighting, matted fur, uniform color' helps
Breaking 0.70 requires: high steps (100), detailed prompt, appropriate resolution
next_steps: Try 150 steps to see if we can hit 0.72+
Test different CFG values (currently using default 3.5)
Backpass: regenerate best prompts with higher settings
